Package monkey.util

Class DirectAddressTable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • monkey.util.DirectAddressTable<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the values to be stored.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    public class DirectAddressTable<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    A generic direct address table indexed using [0 .. length - 1] integers as keys. See T. H. Cormen, C. E. Leiserson, R. L. Rivest, C. Stein, Introduction to Algorithms, 3rd ed., Mcgraw-Hill Book Company, p. 254f.
    Since:
    1.0

      A function associating each value to an integer key in the range [0 ..

        The number of possible keys.

      • search

        public T search​(int key)
        Given a key, returns the value associated to it, or null if such a value does not exist. If null is returned, there is no way to tell whether it represents a missing element or an actual null element previously inserted.
        Parameters:
        key - Key of the value to be returned. It must be in the interval [0 .. length - 1].
        Returns:
        The value associated to the key, or null if such a value does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - key is out of bounds
        Since:
        1.0

      • insert

        public void insert​(T element)
        Inserts an element in the table, updating it if already present.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to be inserted. It may be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - The element's key is out of bounds.
        Since:
        1.0

      • delete

        public void delete​(T element)
        Deletes an element from the table, if it was already present. Otherwise, calling this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to be deleted. It may be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - The element's key is out of bounds.
        Since:
        1.0
